# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is the solution:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    result = ""
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            result *= current_line * "\n"
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    result *= current_line
    return result
end

# Example
println(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))
```

This function splits the input string into words, then iterates over the words. If adding a word to the current line would exceed the maximum width, it adds the current line to the result and starts a new line with the current word. Finally, it adds the last line to the result.
